content: Parenting Lifestyle Investments Asked by Tzerwah TayAsked on 17 Jun 2018How to invest on behalf of my children? Understand that they can only register for CDP account when they are 18. Any suggestions? Philips SBP?1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Marcus GohLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 18 Jun 2018There are two platforms that I know you could help your children to invest in.​DollarDexYou could specify the account type to Joint or Joint-Juvenile depends on the age of your children. Dollardex is more for investing in Index Fund and etc. You can look up on it more on the website.https://www.dollardex.com/sgn/?current=investUTopen/home&previous=home ​FSMOneYou can create a beneficiary account for your children and they are able to invest in the different Asset Class on their own. You can check it out at https://secure.fundsupermart.com/fsm/account-opening/main for more information.​Hope this helps! :)​0 comments0
